BIOGRAPHY

The youngest of three children, Gina Torres began her artistic training through singing at Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School of Music & Art and Performing Arts in New York, where she studied opera and jazz and joined a gospel choir. “There was never a moment when I didn’t sing, when I didn’t dance, because there was always music in the house or in the street. We heard Johnny Pacheco, Celia Cruz, Tito Puente, and Machito. And when the elders weren’t listening to music, My ears took everything from ABBA to Led Zeppelin, Glenn Campbell and Nat King Cole.” (source: official website ) After four years of study, however, she slammed the door of her school: “To say that my parents were not delighted would be a big understatement. I was ready to fly or fall. It was the only way for me to know if I had what it took to succeed in life in this world. Fortunately, everything worked out pretty well.” (source: official website ) But before hitting the small screen Gina Torres made her debut on the stage. She landed her first professional role, that of Deena Jones, in a version of Dreamgirls , before heading to Broadway where she was directed notably by Peter Masterson in the musical The Best Little Whorehouse Goes Public and Jerry Zacks in Faces Value .

Mainly known to the general public for her roles as strong and independent women in the series Alias , Angel and Firefly , Gina Torres is also one of the major figures in Cleopatra 2525 . This science fiction series, going well beyond the limits of kitsch, nevertheless allowed him to win an Alma Award (established by the “National Council of La Raza”, these distinctions are awarded to Latino personalities from the world of entertainment) for his interpretation by Helen Carter. From 2001 she played Anna Espinosa in the JJ Abrams series , Alias . Mortal enemy of Sydney Bristow ( Jennifer Garner ), she only appears in six episodes over the five seasons, but leaves her mark on the series, just as she leaves an indelible memory for Angel fans thanks to her interpretation of the evil Jasmine. But the actress’s main television feat remains Firefly , a sci-fi series by Joss Whedon , the director of Avengers., which has since become cult. Three years later she obtained one of the main roles in the short-lived Standoff: The Negotiators , then crossed paths with Vic Mackey in 2 episodes of The Shield , in which she played Sadie, the wife of Kavanaugh ( Forest Whitaker ). Following a series of appearances, she subsequently played in Eli Stone , Pushing Daisies , Bones , Criminal Minds , FlashForward and Gossip Girl in which she played Vanessa’s mother ( Jessica Szohr ). Since 2011 she has played Jessica Pearson in the series Suits , which has enjoyed great public and critical success on the other side of the Atlantic.

His time in cinema is marked by his role as Cas in the two parts Matrix Reloaded and Revolutions by the Wachowski brothers . There she met her future husband Laurence Fishburne , married in 2002 and with whom she had a child in 2007. Two years later, she reprized her role as Zoe Washburne for Serenity: The Ultimate Rebellion , the film adaptation of the Firefly series. by Joss Whedon . In 2012 she reunited with director Danny Green , met during the Angel years , for the drama Mr. Sophistication , recounting the existential wanderings of a comeback comic, played by Harry J. Lennix .
